headline: Snow blankets Jerusalem - in pictures
text: Ultra-Orthodox Jews walk along the Old City walls  Photograph: Abir Sultan/EPA       Begin Road, one of Jerusalem's main arterial routes is partially open to traffic  Photograph: Nir Alon/Demotix/Corbis       Snow covers the Dome of the Rock in the Old City  Photograph: Darren Whiteside/Reuters       An ultra-Orthodox Jewish boy builds a snowman at the Western Wall Photograph: Uriel Sinai/Getty Images       An ultra-Orthodox Jewish man prays as snow falls at the Western wall Photograph: Uriel Sinai/Getty Images       A pedestrian walks on a snow-covered street in the east Jerusalem neighbourhood of A-tur  Photograph: Ammar Awad/Reuters       Palestinians play in the snow next to a section of Israel's separation barrier in Qalandia, between Jerusalem and the West Bank city of Ramallah Photograph: Majdi Mohammed/AP       A Palestinian man, and a snowman, stand on the roof of a house near the Dome of the Rock Photograph: Abir Sultan/EPA       Snow covers the Russian church in the neighbourhood of Ein Kerem on the western outskirts of Jerusalem  Photograph: Ronen Zvulun/Reuters       An ultra-Orthodox Jewish man looks out a fogged-up bus window Photograph: Baz Ratner/Reuters       Ultra-Orthodox Jewish boys walk down a snow-covered street  Photograph: Uriel Sinai/Getty Images       An ultra-Orthodox Jewish man covered with snow walks in Jerusalem  Photograph: Menahem Kahana/AFP/Getty Images       A man runs as snow falls next to Damascus gate in the old city Photograph: Menahem Kahana/AFP/Getty Images       A girl enjoys sledge ride on an icy road in the Mea Shearim area of the city Photograph: Menahem Kahana/AFP/Getty Images       A man walks near snow-covered palm trees in the old city Photograph: Menahem Kahana/AFP/Getty Images
